text:
How about the ability to add custom pass-through/proxied pages on a HubSpot site? Allowing an oAuth application to add routes to a site could be quite useful for extending functionality (like adding a edit profile section for user profiles)

When the application is installed, it could register routes like:

/dynamic/{page_x} -> <http://myexternalserver.com/HubSpot/{page_x}|myexternalserver.com/HubSpot/{page_x}>

HubSpot could then pass through some contextual information (such as user tokens in the header) which the externally hosted application could use to do some more advanced server-side logic. It could then return HTML or even HUBL which could be passed through HSâ€™s servers and then returned to the user.

Naturally, there are potential performance implications - but adding a timeout could suffice.

Anyone else had to go back and forth with a client multiple times in order to get HubDB permissions in a portal? I have. Would be great if those permissions were bundled together instead of spread across two tabs.

If you agree, would love some upvotes: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Consolidate-HubDB-settings-or-otherwise-move-quot-create-clone/idi-p/355392#M61176>
